1. Enter your symptoms

3. Receive advice and treatment from doctors
4. View your personal treatment plan and other medical documents


Security
Security is a top priority for the Medgate Partner Network. That is why the Medgate App also places particular emphasis on guaranteed data protection. The user's identity is verified with a process that makes use of an identity card. The Medgate App is a medical product with CE certification. 
Medical data is not transmitted to the health insurance company. Medgate is the manufacturer, distributor and operator of the App. Medical services are provided by members of the Medgate Partner Network.
Costs
The consultation is billed via the health insurance company in the context of statutory benefits (analogous to a visit to a doctor's office) and is recognized by all Swiss health insurers. Feedback
The Medgate App is under continuous development and is adapted to the needs of users. We welcome your feedback (info@medgate.ch), so that we can continue to optimize the Medgate App.

EchoSOS, the live saving smart phone app that helps you prepare for emergencies. EchoSOS sends your location to the local emergency service anywhere in the world and provides information about nearby emergency rooms in selected regions. 

How does the app work?
1. In an emergency, open the app: EchoSOS recognises which country you are in and displays the correct emergency service numbers.
2. Dial an emergency number by pressing the appropriate key.
3. Your position will be transmitted so emergency services can find you.

Features
• Displays the local emergency numbers - wherever you are
• Option to add personal emergency numbers
• Nearby emergency rooms and their occupancy (available in selected regions)
• No mobile data? No problem, you location will be transmitted by SMS
• Tried and tested by Swiss emergency services since 2011, available worldwide
• Test function

Know your lab results and follow their progress since 1997.


My Viollier allows you to access your results and reports from Viollier anywhere and anytime, as soon as they are available.


So, your personal lab history is always within reach, whether you’re travelling, visiting your doctor or going to hospital. This way you can help avoid unnecessary repeated testing and contribute to savings in healthcare.


Being able to access your lab results instantaneously gives you immediate reassurance when waiting on urgent results and in critical situations. As soon as a definitive report is available for you, you will immediately receive a push notification, as long as you have allowed notifications.


You can access your reports in PDF format and in four different languages (German, English, French, Italian).


My Viollier allows you to find doctors in your area or at a location of your choosing and make contact directly. 


Approval for My Viollier has to be granted once by your doctor. It is valid for both past and future results. As soon as a doctor has Viollier examinations performed for you, My Viollier allows you to access your result resp. report.


According to Sec. 41 of the Swiss Federal Health Insurance Act (KVG), you are free to choose the medical lab that you want to perform the analyses as part of any outpatient treatment.


To use My Viollier you need a personal e-mail address and your AHV no.


Ask your doctor for My Viollier approval!


Find out more about My Viollier at myviollier.ch

The Rega app is free of charge and offers the following benefits:

• Alert the Rega Operations Centre: your current location is automatically transmitted to Rega. That saves valuable time in an emergency. 
• Share live location: you can share your location with Rega or your contacts when you are pursuing an outdoor activity, such as hiking. Friends or relatives can track your route and alert Rega directly in the app if you fail to return as planned. Then Rega can determine the last transmitted location and initiate a search operation. 
• Test the alarm: check that the app has been configured correctly and that the alarm feature will work correctly in an emergency. 
• Store useful information: in your profile, enter data (e.g. your patronage number) that is important for the Rega Operations Centre in an emergency. 
• Available in neighbouring countries: besides Switzerland and Liechtenstein, the Rega app is available for download in Germany, Austria, France and Italy. 
• The Rega app is available in four languages: German, French, Italian and English, depending on the language setting on your smartphone.

TOM is your handy, anonymous, daily medication reminder that makes it easy for you to manage your medication and daily pill reminders, and allows you to enter measurements, record activities and create reminders for them with alarm. The TOM app is a fully integrated medicine assistant.

With our app, you can add a new medication to your virtual medicine cabinet in just seconds. Your TOM digital assistant does the rest for you. With our app you will forget about any registration, charge, and advertising!


User-friendly and completely anonymous: integrated medicine reminder will notify you whenever it’s time to take your pills, tablets and other medication, making your daily activities much simpler. Now for measurements and activities as well, including graphs and statistics showing everything at a glance.

**Developed by patients, for patients**

TOM tablet reminder with medicine manager is so practical and user-friendly because its developers know from personal experience which requirements a digital medication manager needs to meet. The tablet reminder is the ideal solution for simply and efficiently managing treatment regimens for a wide range of conditions, including diabetes, high blood pressure, asthma, Crohn’s disease, stroke, epilepsy, cardiovascular diseases, multiple sclerosis, and more.


**Key features at a glance**

- Extremely easy to use thanks to dialogue-based design: TOM asks and you reply – without filling in forms or having to tediously search through menus
- Add new medication, measurements or activities quickly and easily
- Send or print PDFs of monthly health reports
- High-quality graphs and statistics for all medication taken, health measurements and activities
- Feature for uploading your own pictures of medication packaging
- Digital medicine cabinet provides a complete list of medication that can even be printed out as a PDF file
- Reminder with alarm to refill prescriptions before they run out or expire
- Fully integrated treatment management that combines a record of medications you have taken with your health measurements (blood pressure and weight, for example) and activities (running, yoga, etc.).
- Keep your patients diary up to date: medications taken daily, medication intervals of several days or hours, single doses or taken sporadically
- Suitable for managing the treatment of a wide range of conditions and diseases (cardiovascular disease, diabetes, high blood pressure, multiple sclerosis, stroke, asthma, etc.)
- Modern solution for managing medications in order to ensure they are taken at the right time and to monitor the progress of your treatment.
- Pill alarm if you forget to take your medications
- Maximum data security thanks to anonymous use of TOM tablet reminder and two-way encryption


**Privacy and data protection are top priority**

Using the TOM tablet reminder is completely anonymous: no registration with personal details required, e.g. email, name, address or phone number. The information you enter is linked only to a randomly generated ID number. Even TOM does not have access to this number, as it is also cryptographically protected. In addition, all communication with the TOM app is encrypted in both directions.

Download the TOM medication manager on your smartphone and let the simple medicine manager add some extra freedom in your daily life. Never forget to take your tablets, pills or other medications again thanks to the medication reminder and pill alarm. Suitable for a wide range of conditions, including high blood pressure, asthma, stroke, cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, etc.
 

SUBMIT YOUR FEEDBACK TO HELP IMPROVE TOM

Thank you for using the TOM app. Your feedback helps us to further develop the TOM medication manager and offer you maximum benefit. We always encourage you to send your suggestions and ideas to support@tommedications.com.

This application indicates, in real time with colour-coded icons, the occupancy trend of the emergency centres located in Vaud for non-vital emergency cases involving adults. The icon colour will be green if the expected occupancy, compared to the average rate, is "low". This indicator does not guarantee that care will be provided immediately, but the process will be faster than in other centres where the occupancy is indicated as "moderate" (yellow) or "high" (red).

The distance between where you are and each centre and the time it will take for you to get there are indicated together with the centre opening hours and other site-specific information.

This application - supported by the Public Health Department of the Canton of Vaud - reminds you to first call your family doctor. If there is no answer, call the Central Switchboard for On-call Doctors, available 24/24, at phone number 0848 133 133. They will give you some first advice. For life-threatening emergencies, call 144.

Alarme können entweder nur auf Ihrem FreeStyle Libre 2 Lesegerät oder nur auf Ihrem Smartphone ausgegeben werden (nicht auf beidem). Denken Sie daran, dass die App und das Lesegerät keine Daten miteinander teilen. FreeStyle LibreLink soll den Glukosespiegel bei Menschen mit Diabetes messen, wenn die App zusammen mit einem Sensor verwendet wird. The Sanitas Coach app is a medical app that helps you manage high blood pressure, type 2 diabetes and sleep problems. It helps prevent illnesses or makes everyday life with one of these illnesses easier. The Sanitas Coach app is a personal coach who is always on hand to help.

Why choose a digital health coach?
Stress, lack of exercise and an unhealthy diet are bad for your health in the long term. An unhealthy lifestyle can lead to high blood pressure, type 2 diabetes and problems sleeping. The Sanitas Coach app helps you keep an eye on your health and gives you the confidence to manage it more easily.

The Sanitas Coach app offers many functions for a healthy lifestyle:

- Self-tests: heart age, risk of type 2 diabetes and sleep quality
- Diary: Blood pressure, blood sugar and sleep quality at a glance
- Feedback on your average values according to medical guidelines
- Reminders for taking medication, measurements and goals
- Step-by-step to a healthier lifestyle through interactive coaching with a friendly chatbot
- Automatic step counting (supported by the Apple HealthKit if you so choose)

What you get with the app

Your digital coach
The Sanitas Coach app is a chatbot that supports you in your daily life. The chatbot asks you questions in an interactive chat. She suggests weekly goals based on your answers. The Sanitas Coach app also provides you with valuable information on your health.

End-to-end coaching
In addition to offering coaching on high blood pressure, the app also helps you manage type 2 diabetes and sleep problems.

Checking blood pressure and blood sugar
The Sanitas Coach app helps you keep a diary of your blood pressure or blood sugar values. The app also reminds you to take your measurements and provides feedback and recommendations for action based on your values. You can export and send your diaries at any time as a PDF. So you always know where you stand.

Sleep diary
The Sanitas Coach app helps you keep a sleep diary so you get a better understanding of your sleep behaviour. And it helps you sleep better by implementing a sleep restriction. You can easily track your sleep quality and export or send the diary at any time as a PDF.

Medication reminder
You can enter medication that you need to take regularly in the app so it sends you a push notification reminding you to take the medication at the right time. Once you’ve taken the medication, you have completed a goal in your daily schedule.

Healthy lifestyle
You get a personal health plan with individual goals for diet, exercise and relaxation. Quickly being able to see initial improvements will motivate you to keep going!

Know-how
Tips and fun quizzes on blood pressure, blood sugar and sleep provide you with a wealth of information.

Developed by experts
The Sanitas Coach app has been developed in cooperation with medical experts from the Hannover Medical School (MHH) and the University Hospital of Bern (Switzerland).

Who is behind the Sanitas Coach app
The manufacturer, operator and distributor of the app is Pathmate Technologies AG. As a Pathmate coach, the Sanitas Coach app is certified as a class I medical device.

Feedback
The Sanitas Coach app has been developed with a lot of love. If you have any problems or questions, please contact sanitas-coach@pathmate.app.

You can find more information on the Sanitas Coach app at https://pathmate.app/sanitascoach/

myCough enables you to monitor your cough in a contactless and automatic way while you sleep. It analyses the nocturnal soundscape and determines whether and how often you cough during the night. myCough also analyses whether a particular type of cough has occurred (e.g. wet or dry cough). The next day you receive detailed information to help you assess whether a medical consultation is necessary.

How you benefit:
• Better assessment and management of your cough.
• Detailed information about your cough (e.g., the type of cough).
• Decision support for medical consultations.

What is special about myCough:
• Nobody listens in on you while you sleep: The app uses a patented technology to analyse your cough directly on your smartphone – no audio data is shared, not even for analysis purposes. 
• You can use the app anonymously: We don’t collect any identifiable information about you and you don’t need to set up an account to use the app.
• Medical device: myCough is based on a certified medical product. However, The app doesn't make diagnoses and doesn't issue any instructions on what action to take. The parameters it provides should help you to assess whether a medical consultation is necessary.

The app is available in German, English, and French. myCough is a collaboration between Resmonics AG, a spin-off of ETH Zurich, and CSS, one of the leading health insurance companies in Switzerland.

Before using it for the first time, you just need to answer a few questions. To track your cough, activate the app and place your smartphone in the bedroom. By the way: The app also works in flight mode.

Good to know:
• Data protection: Your privacy is important to us. You have full control over the data collected. 
• Developed by experts: The technology behind myCough was developed by specialists in Switzerland. All content is based on the latest research findings. 

How does the cough tracking work?
Using the smartphone's microphone, the app uses an artificial intelligence to detect whether sounds are coughs. To learn the acoustic signature of a cough, the system was trained with masses of data from clinical studies.

For whom is myCough designed?
The app is designed for anyone who wants to learn more about their cough while they sleep. myCough is particularly relevant for people with acute or chronic respiratory diseases who want an objective assessment of how their cough develops over time.

What data is collected and processed?
In order to further develop the app, we collect the following data: usage data (e.g. frequency of app use), questionnaire data and data on your cough timeline. It is impossible to identify individual persons with this data. This means that you remain anonymous while using the myCough app, unless you decide to provide your contact details in one of the evaluation questionnaires. 

Are conversations also recorded in the night?
The app uses a patented technology to temporarily store short acoustic segments. Although these segments can theoretically contain snippets of conversations, they are only processed locally on your smartphone. After the analysis, they will immediately be deleted. No acoustic data is stored in the long term or shared with anybody, not even with us. Nobody listens in on you while you sleep.

Please note that even though myCough is based on a medical device, you should seek a doctor’s advice in addition to using this app and before making any medical decisions.

In der Schweiz erleiden jedes Jahr 0,4 bis 1% der Bevölkerung einen Herz-Kreislaufstillstand; das sind bis zu 8000 Personen pro Jahr. 

Nebst Thoraxkompressionen und Beatmung ist die frühe Defibrillation einer der Eckpfeiler einer erfolgreichen Reanimation. AED-Geräte sind Laiendefibrillatoren und können somit nicht nur von Fachleuten bedient werden. Unmittelbar nach Eintritt eines solchen Ereignisses wären bis zu 80% der betroffenen Personen durch unverzüglich eingeleitete Massnahmen reanimierbar. 
Tatsächlich aber überlebten im Jahre 2005 gesamtschweizerisch lediglich 5% der Patienten einen Kreislaufstillstand. 

Die geographische Verteilung der Bevölkerung und auch der Stützpunkte der Rettungsdienste sind sehr unterschiedlich. Entscheidend für das Überleben sind die rasche Alarmierung der professionellen Rettungsdienste sowie unverzüglich begonnene und ohne Unterbruch fortgeführte Wiederbelebungsmassnahmen.

Um Personen mit einem plötzlichen Herz – Kreislaufstillstand so schnell wie nur irgend möglich zu erreichen, wurden durch die regionalen Rettungsdienste freiwillige Gruppen rekrutiert und ausgebildet, welche im Ereignisfall durch die Sanitätsnotrufzentrale 144 Bern alarmiert werden. 

Mit dieser Applikation werden in Sekunden freiwillige Laienhelfer in der Region des Notfalles alarmiert, welche das therapiefreie Intervall bis zum Eintreffen des Rettungsdienstes massiv verkürzen können. Mit dieser Applikation können in kürzerer Zeit und schneller mehr Firstresponder alarmiert werden. Im Tessin stieg die Überlebenswahrscheinlichkeit bei einem plötzlichen Herz – Kreislaufstillstand auf über 40%.

Bitte beachten Sie: wenn die Ortung auf Ihrem Gerät aktiv ist, kann sich das negativ auf die Laufzeit des Akkus auswirken.

Fondazione Ticino Cuore was created in 2005 by the Federation of Ticino Cantonal Services Ambulances and Cardiocentro Ticino with the aim of increasing the survival of people affected by sudden cardiac arrest, which in 10 years has greatly improved , reaching in 2013 a rate of patients discharged alive from the hospital by 43 % (according to Utstein Style) .
To better optimize the activities, Ticino Cuore has decided to develop, in collaboration with DOS -Group, a specific mobile application.
This has been developed with a dual purpose :
· Inform the public about the activities proposed by the Ticino Cuore inherent in the assumption of sudden cardiac arrest, to provide the intervention procedures to be implemented for the practice of resuscitation and defibrillation .

· It servers as a management tool and network alarm "First Responder" (FR ) on the cantonal territory , including the geolocation and help with navigation.
In cases of cardiac arrest, the control panel sends Ticino Soccorso 144, via "push" , a message indicating the location of the intervention and the estimated time of arrival of relief professionals. In the event that the FR is in the vicinity of the patient and is able to confirm its willingness to intervene via the App and its intervention is managed and recorded directly from Ticino Cuore 144.

· In addition, this app allows you to directly alarm emergency services, see public defibrillators on a map and receive regular news.
You need to register, log in via direct within the app or via the website www.ticinocuore.ch, as FR activation occurs after the verification of compliance with the basic requirements (BLS / AED valid certificate) and the acceptance of the general conditions.

Note: continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.

Anatomy Touch Pro is a game, which provides an easy way to learn anatomical structures like bones, muscles or organs.


Features:

3 different modes to learn!

• Choose It:
In this mode an anatomical structure from a selected lesson is highlighted. 
You have to find the correct term out of 4 given options. 
Difficulty: easy
Perfect for beginners!

• Touch It:
An terminological name is given - like "humerus". 
Your task is to find this structure on an anatomical image and touch the correct body part. 
Difficulty: medium
Perfect for advanced learners!

• Type It:
An anatomical structure from the human body is highlighted. 
Your task is to type the name of the shown structure.
Difficulty: hard
Perfect for experts!


The language of the terms can be choosed between latin or english.

• overview of important bones
• skeleton of the hip and spinal column, upper and lower limb and the skull

• anatomical structures of the heart, lungs, gastrointestinal tract and brain

Early detection is key to prevention and timely treatment. In fact, over 95% of skin cancers can be successfully treated if they are found early. This is why dermatologists recommend performing skin checks every 3 to 6 months. Now you can do this simply with SkinVision on your smartphone. 

Our checks use an algorithm to assess your mole or skin spot for cancerous signs. Our service is quality assured by our team of dermatology experts. Our users have received more than 3.5 million risk assessments and we’ve found over 50,000 cases of melanoma and other types of skin cancer.
